discussion_comments.comment_body: pre-existing, but this bit in building kubeSchedulerRules should be guarded on the DRADeviceTaints feature, this shouldn't be showing up in default RBAC policy yet

commented_code:
lifecycle of a container.
   release: v1.19
   file: test/e2e/common/node/expansion.go
+- testname: 'DRA driver: creates slices'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] ResourceSlice
+    Controller creates slices [Conformance]'
+  description: The helper code for DRA drivers must be able to publish large ResourceSlices.
+  release: v1.34
+  file: test/e2e/dra/dra.go
+- testname: 'Dynamic Resource Allocation: must apply per-node permission checks'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] control plane

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2843,6 +2843,196 @@
     lifecycle of a container.
   release: v1.19
   file: test/e2e/common/node/expansion.go
+- testname: 'DRA driver: creates slices'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] ResourceSlice
+    Controller creates slices [Conformance]'
+  description: The helper code for DRA drivers must be able to publish large ResourceSlices.
+  release: v1.34
+  file: test/e2e/dra/dra.go
+- testname: 'Dynamic Resource Allocation: must apply per-node permission checks'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] control plane
discussion_comments.comment_body:
We should probably drop all the `FeatureGate` from conformance tests. Conformance tests may not be skipped.

(This is new, we wound up doing that in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/132219 and I think that's correct)

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2843,6 +2843,196 @@
     lifecycle of a container.
   release: v1.19
   file: test/e2e/common/node/expansion.go
+- testname: 'DRA driver: creates slices'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] ResourceSlice
+    Controller creates slices [Conformance]'
+  description: The helper code for DRA drivers must be able to publish large ResourceSlices.
+  release: v1.34
+  file: test/e2e/dra/dra.go
+- testname: 'Dynamic Resource Allocation: must apply per-node permission checks'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] control plane
discussion_comments.comment_body: But `[FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation]` is just informational and not wrong. It's not used for skipping tests, unless someone uses a non-default SKIP expression. I prefer to keep it.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2843,6 +2843,196 @@
     lifecycle of a container.
   release: v1.19
   file: test/e2e/common/node/expansion.go
+- testname: 'DRA driver: creates slices'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] ResourceSlice
+    Controller creates slices [Conformance]'
+  description: The helper code for DRA drivers must be able to publish large ResourceSlices.
+  release: v1.34
+  file: test/e2e/dra/dra.go
+- testname: 'Dynamic Resource Allocation: must apply per-node permission checks'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] control plane
discussion_comments.comment_body: OTOH, I can also just replace it with plain text "Dynamic Resource Allocation". It doesn't need to be injected via `framework.WithFeatureGate` and (more importantly!) at some point it **cannot** be injected that way because the feature gate will get removed eventually - might as well change the test definition now because the GA feature shouldn't get turned off for testing.

discussion_comments.commented_code:

   file: test/e2e/common/node/expansion.go

+    Controller creates slices [Conformance]'

+  release: v1.34
+  file: test/e2e/dra/dra.go
+- testname: 'Dynamic Resource Allocation: must apply per-node permission checks'
+  codename: '[sig-node] [DRA] [FeatureGate:DynamicResourceAllocation] control plane

commented_code:
#    --config <(cat test/e2e/dra/kind.yaml; echo "  <some feature>: true")
 featureGates:
   DynamicResourceAllocation: true
+  DRAExtendedResource: true

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -53,3 +53,4 @@ nodes:
 #    --config <(cat test/e2e/dra/kind.yaml; echo "  <some feature>: true")
 featureGates:
   DynamicResourceAllocation: true
+  DRAExtendedResource: true
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Please don't add this manually. The file is also used in jobs which want to run just with core DRA.

The alpha job will add it for you automatically, so your tests will still run.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -53,3 +53,4 @@ nodes:
 #    --config <(cat test/e2e/dra/kind.yaml; echo "  <some feature>: true")
 featureGates:
   DynamicResourceAllocation: true
+  DRAExtendedResource: true
discussion_comments.comment_body: Right. I intended to add it locally to run the test. Now it is removed.

discussion_comments.comment_body: Yes. ResourceClaim status was also enabled by default at beta. Such beta's then don't do much unless the DynamicResourceAllocation feature gate gets enabled, but that's fine.
